title: 108_hr1106
content:
The "Fremont-Madison Conveyance Act" defines terms like "District" and "Secretary" and involves the conveyance of facilities. The Secretary of the Interior is required to convey water distribution and drainage system components to the Fremont-Madison Irrigation District in Idaho. If the conveyance is not completed by September 13, 2004, a report must be submitted to Congress explaining the delay. The Secretary will require the District to pay administrative costs for the conveyance and related activities. Additionally, the District must pay the net present value of remaining obligations or $280,000 to the United States. Amounts received will go into the Reclamation Fund. SEC. 5. TETON EXCHANGE WELLS.

In conveying the Teton Exchange Wells, the Secretary shall also convey Idaho Department of Water Resources permit number 22-7022 and all equipment appurtenant to such wells. The water service contract between the Secretary and the District is extended until all conditions are fulfilled.

SEC. 6. ENVIRONMENTAL REVIEW

Prior to conveyance, the Secretary shall complete all environmental reviews and analyses as set forth in the Memorandum of Agreement referenced in section 3(a).

SEC. 7. LIABILITY. SEC. 7. LIABILITY. Effective upon conveyance, the United States will not be liable for damages related to the conveyed facilities, except for negligence prior to conveyance. This does not increase liability beyond current provisions in title 28, United States Code. SEC. 8. WATER SUPPLY TO DISTRICT LANDS. The acreage eligible for water from the Minidoka and Teton Basin Projects in the District is increased to include all current and annexed lands. This does not affect existing water contracts or state water law. SEC. 9. DROUGHT MANAGEMENT PLANNING. Within 60 days of enactment, the Secretary will collaborate with stakeholders in the Henry's Fork watershed to start a drought management planning process for all water uses. A report with the final drought management plan must be submitted to Congress within 18 months. SEC. 10. EFFECT. This section clarifies that the Act does not affect the rights of any person or the water rights of the Shoshone-Bannock Tribes of the Fort Hall Reservation. Any conveyance under the Act will not impact existing contracts or state laws regarding water rights.
